title: 2 Seaport restaurants to close and lay off 84 employees
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants The closures were first reported by the Boston Business Journal after a WARN filing was posted publicly last week.
Temazcal and Tony C's, both located at 250 Northern Ave.
in the Seaport, are closing.

title: South Shore teen sentenced for creating, sharing child sex videos
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Matthew Quinn changed his initial plea to guilty on all five charges on Wednesday.
A South Shore teen was sentenced on Wednesday for creating and sharing child sex videos.
Matthew Quinn is a 19-year-old from Pembroke, according to MassLive.

title: Man charged with stealing cars from Boston garages for joyrides, dragging officer
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime "This defendant was clearly drawn to high-end automobiles in parking garages and had no hesitation in stealing them or putting officers’ lives in danger when he got caught in them.
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Dorchester man was charged with a series of parking garage thefts and dragging a police officer in Boston, the Suffolk County District Attorney announced on Sunday.

title: Jury finds Brian Walshe guilty of wife Ana’s murder
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Walshe was charged with first-degree murder for allegedly killing his wife, Ana, on New Year's Day 2023.
Brian Walshe, center, with lawyers Kelli Porges and Larry Tipton, listens to the jury announce their guilty verdict.
Greg Derr / The Patriot Ledger via Pool By Beth Treffeisen updated on December 15, 2025 | 1:06 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Red Sox reportedly have ‘informal and exploratory’ Jarren Duran trade talks
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "The Royals are under the impression Duran would cost them left-hander Cole Ragans.
" Jarren Duran during the 2025 season with the Red Sox.
